Reviews.Content: What a GREAT hotel! I loved this hotel. The location is great, just outside the Porta Romano, one of the gates to the old city wall. It is a short walk to the bus, and a 15 minute walk to the Ponte Vecchio, all a flat, easy walk.It was quiet and romantic, and very reasonably priced. The night-shift woman at the desk was so nice and helpful. I was traveling alone, and would definitely recommend this place. I agree with the previous comment about breakfast. Especially if you have to pay, skip the breakfast.
Reviews.Author: SFvoyager08

Reviews.Content: Super location, lovely staff Spent a week here in early April. The hotel had a real comfy feel to it, and our room by Italian standards was gigantic! Staff couldn't have been more helpful, where to eat, where to visit and so on, also booking some of our visits for us so we didn't have to join the queues. We followed all their suggestions and were delighted. The best part though was the location on a lovely tree-lined avenue; peace and quiet and still only 10 minutes stroll from the Pitti Palace and the Ponte Vecchio. Breakfast hasn't really improved but this is a minor quibble. I'd go back in a flash. (Just to put this in context, I'm middle-aged, female and not into late-night partying!)
Reviews.Author: GobnaitOh

Reviews.Content: Theft and appalling treatment we stayed at the classic hotel for 3 nights in july. on the second morning i returned to my room at 11.30am and noticed that the door was wide open. this was strange as i had just picked up the key from reception. the maid came from around the corner, flustered, and told me i needed to lock my room. once inside i discovered that the safe was open. i checked my jewlery box and everything seemed to me there. that night i looked through my suitcase for a favorite silk skirt and it was missing. i thought i may have left it at our villa we had previsouly rented. however, on checking out the next morning i discovered that 4 items of clothing were missing including a top that i had worn to the hotel. at that point i knew they had been stolen. i told the gentleman on the front desk who said it was 'impossible' and that if it was the case i needed to get a police report. as a courtesy he also deducted one night stay from my bill. the items stolen were worth about $800. one nights stay was $120!i spent an entire day and about 50 euros in taxis getting the report. i did not pay my bill and the hotel agreed to file a claim with their insurance company to cover the room and maybe my clothes. they could offer no idea if or when i would see any compensation. i know the maid took my things and told the receptionist. i even offered a 150 euro reward if they were 'found'. i have had little or no communication from the hotel. the one email i finally received was in very formal and legal italian telling me that the insurance co had a 150 euro deductible and that they did not make credits to foroeign credit cards. i was also expetcing mail at the hotel and was emailing to see if it had been received. they finally responded and told me it had been returned to sender. this was actually a replacement credit card that i needed for my trip.i asked to see the owner and was told that she was not in florence and so unavalable unless i was paying my total bill then she would see me. i was thoroughly shocked at how badly i was treated. as far as i know the maid was never questioned. i asked for her details to offer her the chance to send the clothes to me in return for the reward and the hotel refused to give me her info. this experience ruined my trip in florence and i would never recommend that anyone stay there.tanyia kandohla-mullens , mill valley, california
Reviews.Author: tanyia

Reviews.Content: What a nice break from Scooter maniacs...Perfect for DRIVERS Very nice. We enjoyed our stay, partly because of the Classic Hotel. Wonderful green neighborhood. Classic old tall building. Our room on the first floor, left corner was so TALL that they had a separate accommodation above (loft style) for our kid. PERFECT. Bird chirping in the morning and lovley setting. Wonderful grounds (what hotel in Florence has grounds?) Outstanding sunroom for sitting and reading. Tables outside. Trees all over the grounds. And, if you are driving, generous, attractive parking. Unheard of. Very friendly people, very helpful. Nice little breakfast. Long walk to Ponte Vecchio...but we got used to it and did it many times. The hotel is a quiet retreat from the insane blasting scooter and vehicle noise that otherwise curses Florence. OK, OK, there is a road in front that carries some traffic, but very little noise and quiet at night. Ahhhhh. Reasonable price. Highly recommended. We would go again if my wife could ever get me to go back to wildly overcrowded and noisy Florence (doubtful)....
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Definitely a Classic I spent 4 nights at the Classic Hotel. The hotel is in a lovely 19th century villa and has very pleasant grounds. Given the crowds and traffic in the heart of Florence, there is much to be said for having a retreat just outside the city walls. It is about a 2 block walk to the city wall and the bus stop, and about a 15 minute walk to the River Arno. (The only problem with walking into town is that the sidewalks are narrow, and the buses that rumble by are rather large.) There are various small stores, post office, and banks near the bus stop. This area of Florence has a relatively 'lived-in' feel -- yes, there will be plenty of tourists on the streets, but also locals going about their daily activities. The hotel staff were all very pleasant and spoke good English. As other reviewers have noted, breakfast is adequate but no more than that (but who goes to Florence for the breakfasts?) The room and bathroom were clean, comfortable, and reasonably spacious.The last night I was there, several mosquitoes had a happy time biting me. Although it was cool enough to leave the window open overnight, rather than use the air conditioner, I should have relied on modern technology! Keeping the window closed at night would also have cut the traffic noise. (There are far too many motor scooters in Florence, and a few of them are ridden along the Viale Machiavelli.)
Reviews.Author: Dot33

Reviews.Content: The Best Hotel in Florence, Italy...: ) This hotel is within an extremely romantic setting and sorrounded by the Boboli Gardens. It is minutes away from the center of town but it's seclusion from it makes this mansion the ideal setting for a quite romantic vacation. Also, don't forget you are actually staying next to the Machiavelli's mansion. On your first and last night don't forget to go to restaurante Mama Gina...
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great value, shame about the breakfast! My boyfriend and I stayed at the 3* Classic Hotel, Florence in June 2004. Just outside the old-town walls, it's a pretty, 19thC villa set on a (very welcome) shady street alongside the Boboli gardens. It's a 20min walk to the Uffizzi and other Florentine spectacles, but you can jump on the bus and be there in 5. The rooms are generally large and decorated with antiques, but bathrooms are on the small side. Our room was double height - and the bathroom was up on a mezzanine, together with a sofa and further single bed. Considering the prices of hotels in Florence we thought it was good value even without the usual mini-bar/room service facilities. The only problem was the breakfast. Italians don't do breakfast, as we found out here - a few crusty rolls, pastries, appalling coffee and cornflakes were on the buffet, though none looked appetising. The fruit juice machine was not working and there was no way to make proper Espresso coffee. I even had to search the cupboards for a bowl and spoon as none had been left out. When we decided to forgo breakfast on the second morning, we were surprised to see it had been credited on our final bill - and to the tune of 16 Euros per person - so well worth just grabbing something from the local cafes on the morning walk into the centre! However the great benefit to those driving is it is one of the only hotels of this rating to have parking - notoriously difficult in the rest of Florence.
Reviews.Author: eleanort6
